links.scene: Bran Stark, the ten-year-old third son of Lord Eddard Stark, is practicing his archery in Winterfell’s courtyard. His father and mother, Lady Catelyn (formerly of House Tully), are watching. His elder brothers Robb Stark and Jon Snow (a bastard, born to a different mother than Catelyn) are helping him.

links.speech: Nine years. Why haven’t I seen you? Where the hell have you been?
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: Guarding the North for you, Your Grace. Winterfell is yours.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Where’s the Imp?
links.speaker: arya

links.speech: Will you shut up?
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: Thank you, Magister.
links.speaker: daenerys

links.speech: Your Grace.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: You’ve got fat.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: We’ve brought up eight barrels of ale from the cellar. Perhaps we’ll find out.
links.speaker: luwin

links.speech: Your sister. The boy …
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: How much could he possibly drink? A man of his … stature.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: I’m told he drinks all night.
links.speaker: luwin

links.speech: We need plenty of candles for Lord Tyrion’s chamber. I’m told he reads all night.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Arya.
links.speaker: arya

links.speech: That’s Jaime Lannister. The queen’s twin brother.
links.speaker: arya

links.speech: Would you please shut up.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: He was talking madness. Said the Walkers slaughtered his friends.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Of course I did. Just a lad. But he was tough, Ned. A true Ranger.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: A wildling ambush.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Hush now. Your father hasn’t even said yes.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: He’d have to leave home. He’d have to leave me. And so would you.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Why would he say no? He’d be the second most powerful man in the kingdoms.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: Sansa…
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: You left your home to come here. And I’d be queen someday. Please make father say yes.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: So do I. I want us both to go home. But they took it from us. So tell me, sweet sister, how do we go home?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: I’m not a Stark. Get on.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: We go home with an army. With Khal Drogo’s army. I would let his whole tribe fuck you, all 40,000 men and their horses too, if that’s what it took.
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: I don’t know.
links.speaker: daenerys

links.speech: Then he is the stupidest prince that ever lived.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Do you think Joffrey will like me? What if he thinks I’m ugly?
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: When would we be married? Soon or do we have to wait?
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: He’s so handsome.
links.speaker: sansa

links.scene: A raven arrives at Winterfell, bearing a message. Catelyn collects the message and travels across the castle to the godswood.

At Castle Black, three rangers of the Night’s Watch – Will, Gared, and Ser Waymar Royce – pass through the tunnel under the Wall and into the Haunted Forest beyond. They are investigating reports of a group of wildlings based in the forest nearby. Will splits off from the others to undertake a reconnaissance. He finds the wildlings lying dead in the snow, dismembered with their bodies, entrails and blood arranged in an unusual pattern, as well a young wildling girl impaled on a tree. Horrified, he runs back to his companions.
 Ser Waymar dismisses the carnage, asking what Will expects from savages like the wildlings; Will retorts that he has never seen wildlings do anything like the butchery he found in the clearing. Will and Gared suggest they head back to Castle Black, as they have confirmed that the wildlings are no longer a threat. Ser Waymar points out that the Lord Commander will ask what killed the wildlings and they need to investigate further. Will points out that they could meet the same fate, but Ser Waymar dismisses his concerns. He states that if Will were to flee south, he’d be beheaded as a deserter.
 Returning to the spot of the massacre, they find no sign of the wildlings, only a few spots of blood. Ser Waymar and Gared investigate the site whilst Will scouts the surrounding area. Gared finds a bloody bit of clothing on the floor. Ser Waymar asks what it is, but before he can answer a tall, shadowy figure with glowing blue eyes rises from the snow behind him and speaks with a voice like cracking ice. Gared,stunned in terrified silence, can only attempt to mouth a warning, pointing at the danger behind his fellow ranger; Ser Waymar turns to see what is the matter and is swiftly killed by the creature as it swings a sword at him.
 Will hears Gared’s cries, but before he can respond he sees the dead wildling girl from earlier. She is now standing by herself and turns to look at Will with blue eyes similar to those of the creatures. Will flees. He encounters Gared and is just in time to see him being beheaded by another of the creatures. The creature throws the head to land at Will’s feet. Will looks up to meet his fate.

links.speech: In any case, candles.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: You can always say no, Ned.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Think of all those southern girls he gets to stab with his right royal prick.
links.speaker: theon

links.speech: They both have their health. Gods be good. [pause] The raven brought more news. The king rides for Winterfell. With the queen and all the rest of them.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: He’s coming this far North, there’s only one thing he’s after.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Get the lads to saddle their horses.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Lord Stark. My lady. A guardsman just rode in from the hills. They’ve captured a deserter from the Night’s Watch.
links.speaker: cassel

links.speech: I’m not worthy of the honor.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: I hear the prince is a right royal prick.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: Why’s your mother so dead-set on us getting pretty for the king?
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: It’s for the queen, I bet. I hear she’s [sleek as a mink?]
links.speaker: theon

links.scene: Benjen speaks to his brother at the feast. Eddard asks him if he knew Will and Benjen replies he did. He was a young lad, but tough, a true ranger. Eddard says he was speaking madness about the White Walkers slaughtering his friends. Benjen says the two he was with are still missing beyond the Wall. Eddard points out it could have been a wildling ambush and Benjen says it could. However, times are odd: direwolves south of the Wall, talk of the Walkers and his brother could be the next Hand of the King. He wryly says, "Winter is Coming." Benjen then greets Robb.

Up in the hills, Will is brought before Eddard. He claims that he saw the White Walkers. He admits the deserting his post was wrong and he should have returned to the Wall to warn them, but he was too terrified and just wanted to flee. He asks Eddard to send word to his family. Eddard pronounces the death sentence on him and Jon urges Bran not to look away. Eddard beheads Will using his Valyrian steel greatsword, Ice. Bran does not flinch. Jon tells him he did well.
 Afterwards, Eddard asks Bran why it was necessary for him to behead the deserter personally. Bran replies that the Starks’ way is the old way, and Eddard agrees, saying that the man who passes the sentence should swing the sword. Bran asks if it is true that Will saw the White Walkers, but Eddard tells him that they have been gone for thousands of years, and he suspects that Will was a madman.

links.speech: Preparing for a night with your family. I’ve always wanted to see the Wall.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: What’re you doing back there?
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: My greatest accomplishment. You – you’re Ned Stark’s bastard, aren’t you?
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: You’re Tyrion Lannister. The queen’s brother?
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: The boy I beheaded. Did you know him?
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Your uncle’s in the Night’s Watch.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: You might, if you knew what it meant. … I’d better get inside. Rescue your father from his guests. We’ll talk later.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: Make him happy.
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: Lord Eddard Stark is my father.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: Did I offend you? Sorry. You are the bastard, though.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: Do you know the Common Tongue?
links.speaker: daenerys

links.speech: No.
links.speaker: khal_drogo

links.scene: Will, having apparently escaped certain death beyond the Wall, is making his way through the hills near Winterfell, the seat of House Stark. He is captured by a group of riders flying the Stark banner.

links.speech: Close the door!
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: Take me to your crypt. I want to pay my respects.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: I thought you might say that. But since we’re short on time, (he opens the door; a bevy of whores enter and descend on TYRION) Come on, girls. See you at sundown.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: I’m sorry, I’ve begun the feast a bit early. And this is the first of many courses.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: The two he was with are still missing.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: White Walkers. I saw the White Walkers. White Walkers. The White Walkers, I saw them.
links.speaker: will

links.speech: In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, first of his name …
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Close as any man would.
links.speaker: will

links.speech: Don’t look away.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: I know I broke my oath. And I know I’m a deserter. I should have gone back to the Wall and warned them. But I saw what I saw. I saw the White Walkers. People need to know. If you can get word to my family, tell them I’m no coward. Tell them I’m sorry.
links.speaker: will

links.speech: One minute he was fine, and then … Burned right through him, whatever it was. I loved that man.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: Forgive me, lord.
links.speaker: will

links.speech: Tell me about Jon Arryn.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Ned. Ten is too young to see such things.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: He won’t be a boy forever. And winter is coming.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Maybe. Direwolves south of the wall. Talk of the Walkers. My brother might be the next Hand to the king. Winter is coming.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: Robb boy. How are ye?
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: Uncle Benjen.
links.speaker: robb

links.scene:
In bed after the feast, Catelyn and Eddard talk about how fat Robert has gotten. Catelyn tells Eddard again that he can still refuse the offer, and if Robert has a problem with that he can talk to her about it. They are interrupted by Maester Luwin, who has received an urgent message for Catelyn. The letter is from her sister, Lysa. Catelyn is surprised to see that the message has come from the Eyrie, the seat of House Arryn in the Vale. Catelyn thought her sister was still in the capital.
 Catelyn reads the letter and immediately burns it. She tells Eddard that, according to Lysa, the Lannisters are plotting against King Robert. They arranged Jon Arryn’s death and the king’s life is in danger. Lysa has fled to the Vale with her son to prevent any action being taken against them. Luwin gives them his counsel: Robert trusts Eddard more than any other man. If there is a plot against the king, Eddard is the best man to smoke it out in the capital. Catelyn angrily replies that Eddard has spent half his life fighting wars for Robert and has served him more than ably enough. She also points out that Eddard's father and brother once rode south and never came back, but Luwin points out that that was a different time and a different king.

On the beach near Pentos, the wedding of Khal Drogo and Daenerys is held. There is feasting and dancing. Viserys asks when they can start planning the invasion of Westeros, but Illyrio replies that the Dothraki do things in their own time, and will only make war when their omens favor it. Viserys is unimpressed by their omens.
 Two Dothraki get into an altercation over a girl; the two men pummel each other first with fists, then swords are drawn and one kills the other. Illyrio tells Viserys that a Dothraki wedding without at least three deaths is considered a dull affair.
 Daenerys and Drogo are given many gifts. Drogo is pleased to see "Jorah the Andal", a noted warrior from Daenerys’s own country. He introduces himself as Ser Jorah Mormont of Bear Island. He gifts Daenerys with books of songs and stories from the Seven Kingdoms. He says he is loyal to the true king of Westeros and hopes to always serve him. Viserys accepts his offer.
 Illyrio then presents his gift: three spherical, stone objects. He tells Daenerys that they are reportedly dragon eggs, from the Shadow Lands beyond Asshai. The centuries have turned them to stone, but they are still beautiful. Daenerys is impressed by the gift.
 Drogo declares the feasting done and gives Daenerys his own gift to her: a beautiful white horse. She asks Jorah how to say, "Thank you," in Dothraki, but he replies that there is no such phrase in their language. Drogo lifts her onto the horse and they prepare to ride off. Viserys urges her to make him happy.

In Winterfell, Sansa and Catelyn prepare for the feast. Sansa gushes about Joffrey’s good looks and hopes he will like her. Sansa asks how long they will have to wait to be married, but Catelyn tells her that her father has not even decided to accept the king’s offer. Sansa is puzzled as to why he would refuse: the King’s Hand is the second-most-powerful position in the Seven Kingdoms. Catelyn tells her that Sansa would have to leave Winterfell and leave her parents behind, but Sansa points out that Catelyn had to leave her home and family to come to Winterfell. Sansa begs her mother to convince Eddard to accept the king’s offer: being queen one day is Sansa’s greatest dream.

links.speech: Lord Stark? There are five pups. One for each of the Stark children. The direwolf is the sigil of your House. They were meant to have them.
links.speaker: jon

links.scene:
Illyrio and Viserys look out across the Narrow Sea, towards Westeros, and Illyrio tells Viserys that it won't be long now before he takes back his father's throne. He tells him that the people want the return of their rightful king, and drink secret toasts to Viserys's health. Viserys asks when the marriage will take place and Illyrio replies very soon, as the Dothraki do not like to stay in one place for very long.
 Viserys asks if it is true that the Dothraki lie with their horses. Illyrio advises against asking Khal Drogo this. Viserys angrily asks if he thinks he is a fool, but Illyrio smoothly says that Viserys is a king, and kings sometimes lack the caution of common men. Viserys is aware of the deal: he will give Drogo a queen, and he will give him an army.
 Daenerys speaks up, saying that she does not want to be Drogo’s queen. She just wants to go home. Viserys agrees, but points out that their home has been taken from them. The only way they can go home is with an army, Khal Drogo's army, and he would let every one of the forty thousand soldiers and all of their horse in that army have sex with Daenerys if that is what it takes.

Bran defies his mother’s command and goes climbing again, this time up the side of one of Winterfell’s towers. Hearing noises from within, he investigates and sees Jaime and Cersei having sex. They spot him and Jaime grabs him before he can escape. Cersei panics, saying that, "He saw us." Jaime asks Bran how old he is. When he says ten, Jaime says, "The things I do for love," and pushes him from the tower. Bran plummets dozens of feet to the ground.

links.speech: And Lady Stark is not your mother. Making you a bastard. Let me give you some advice, bastard. Never forget what you are. The rest of the world will not. Wear it like armor. Then it can never be used to hurt you.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: What the hell do you know about being a bastard?
links.speaker: jon

links.scene: The feast gets underway and Catelyn and Cersei sit at the high table. Robert is drinking heavily and starts kissing one of the serving girls, to Cersei’s evident disgust.

links.speech: I know how to play a man like Drogo. I give him a queen and he gives me an army.
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: All dwarves are bastards in their fathers’ eyes.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: You at a feast -- It’s like a bear in a trap.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: What about you?
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: King of the Andals and the First Men …
links.speaker: ned

links.scene:
Jon Snow is practicing with his sword in the Winterfell courtyard. His uncle, Benjen Stark, rides into the castle, having just come south from the Wall. They embrace and Jon says he was not welcome at the feast. Benjen, concerned about Jon, offers him a place amongst the sworn brothers of the Night’s Watch. Jon considers only for a moment before accepting. Surprised at the speed of his response, Benjen points out that there are drawbacks to being a member of the Watch, such as not being able to take a wife or have children. Jon says he does not care about that, but Benjen points out he might, one day. Benjen goes into the feast, suggesting they’ll talk about this again later.
 Tyrion Lannister arrives at the courtyard, catching the end of the conversation. He introduces himself to Jon and muses that he’s always wanted to see the Wall. He states that Jon is "the bastard", to Jon’s annoyance. Noting this, Tyrion advises him to take the name and wrap himself in it, using it as armour so it can never hurt him. The rest of the world will never forget what he is, so why should he? Jon angrily asks what he might know about being a bastard. Tyrion replies that "All dwarfs are bastards in their father's eyes."

The Stark family members and their retainers gather ahead of the royal party’s arrival. Catelyn is puzzled by Arya’s absence, but she manages to arrive ahead of the party. Eddard admonishes her.
 The royal party arrives. Robb notes a smile exchanged between Prince Joffrey and Sansa. Arya starts identifying members of the royal party, but Sansa tells her to shut up. Eddard watches in slight bemusement as King Robert, who is a portly man, requires help to dismount his horse. He greets Eddard by telling him he’s gotten fat. When Eddard raises a questioning eyebrow at the king’s own girth, they both burst into laughter. Robert greets Catelyn and the children warmly, telling Sansa she is a beauty and Bran that he will be a soldier. Queen Cersei also greets the Starks, though more reservedly. Robert asks Eddard to take him to the crypts so he can pay his respects. Cersei objects, pointing out they have been on the road for a month, but Robert ignores her.
 As Robert and Eddard leave, Arya ponders where ‘the Imp’ is. Overhearing, an annoyed Cersei tells Jaime to go and find their missing brother.

links.speech: Please, father!
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: You will train them yourselves. You will feed them yourselves. And if they die, you will bury them yourselves.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Thank you.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: Fine work, as always. Well done.
links.speaker: septa_mordane

links.speech: And your mother.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: Go on. Father’s watching.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: It’s …
links.speaker: gared

links.speech: What is it?
links.speaker: royce

links.speech: I don’t fight in tournaments.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: No? Getting a little old for it?
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: I don’t fight in tournaments because when I fight a man for real, I don’t want him to know what I can do.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Your dead men seem to have moved camp.
links.speaker: royce

links.speech: Relax your bow arm.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: Don’t think too much, Bran.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: And which one of you was a marksman at ten? Keep practicing, Bran. Go on.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: I love the detail that you’ve managed to get in this corners. … Quite beautiful … the stitching …
links.speaker: septa_mordane

links.speech: Lad, go run back and get the rest.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: He swore an oath, Cat.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: The law is law, my lady.
links.speaker: cassel

links.speech: He never had to teach you much, but me … You remember me at 16? All I wanted to do was crack skulls and fuck girls. He showed me what was what.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: Tell Bran he’s coming, too.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Your Grace.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Cat!
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: No.
links.speaker: khal_drogo

links.speech: Don’t look at me like that. Not his fault I didn’t listen. (They laugh. ROBERT sighs.) I need you, Ned. Down at Kings Landing. Not up here, where you’re no damn use to anybody. Lord Eddard Stark, I would name you the Hand of the king.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: She’s beautiful. … Ser Jorah, I don’t know how to say ‘thank you’ in Dothraki.
links.speaker: daenerys

links.speech: See where they went.
links.speaker: gared

links.speech: There is no word for ‘thank you’ in Dothraki.
links.speaker: jorah

links.scene: Eddard Stark’s two daughters, thirteen-year-old Sansa and her younger sister Arya, are practicing their needlework at the direction of Septa Mordane. Arya is bored by the exercise, especially as she can hear the sounds of the archery practice outside.

links.speech: Should I explain to you the meaning of a closed door in a whorehouse, brother?
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: Did you have to bury her in a place like this? She should be on a hill somewhere with the sun and the clouds above her.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: She has odd cravings, our sister.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: You’ve much to teach me, no doubt. But our sister craves your attention.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: Have you?
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: A family trait. Now, the Starks are feasting us at sundown. Don’t leave me alone with these people.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: Don’t get up.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: The gods gave me one blessing.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: The things I do for love.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: We should head back to the wall.
links.speaker: gared

links.speech: M’lord.
links.speaker: ros

links.speech: No, Your Grace.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: And have you bled yet?
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: I think so, Your Grace.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: You’re tall. Still growing?
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: It’s Maester Luwin, my lord.
links.speaker: a_voice

links.speech: He only stops eating when it’s time for a drink.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: How did he get so fat?
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: I’ll say, ‘Listen, fat man, you are not taking my husband anywhere. He belongs to me now.’
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Do you take me for a fool?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: Arya!
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: Well said.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: The king takes what he wants. That’s why he’s king.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: I won’t let him take you.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: I’m a Northman. I belong here with you, not down south in that rat’s nest they call a capital.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Time for bed.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: She was my sister. This is where she belongs.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: So he was lying?
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: I hear we might share a grandchild someday.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: I hear the same.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: And your dress. Did you make it?
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: Such talent. You must make something for me.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: I hear we might be neighbors soon. I hope it’s true.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: Yes, the king has honored me with his offer.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Your daughter will do well in the capital. Such a beauty shouldn’t stay hidden up here forever.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: Your pardon.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: I’m sure we’ll have a tournament to celebrate the new title, if you accept. It would be good to have you in the field. The competition has become a bit stale.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: You have five northern children. You’re not an outsider.
links.speaker: ned

links.scene:
Eddard is sitting in front of the godswood’s heart tree, cleaning his blade. Catelyn arrives, musing that she still feels like an outsider in this place. Eddard laughs, pointing out that she has five northern children and is not an outsider. Catelyn wonders if the Old Gods of the Forest agree, but Eddard replies that it’s her gods that have all the rules.
 Eddard notices that Catelyn is upset and she tells him that there has been a raven from King’s Landing: Jon Arryn is dead. She knows he was like a father to Eddard, and she is sorry for his loss. He was taken by a sudden fever. His wife, Lysa, who is also Catelyn’s sister, is well, as is her son Robin. Catelyn tells him there is more: King Robert and his entire retinue are already riding for Winterfell. Eddard realises there is only one reason why the king might be coming all this way to see him. She points out that he can always say no.

Winterfell prepares for the royal party’s arrival. Catelyn informs Maester Luwin that they will need a large number of candles, as Tyrion Lannister (Jaime and Cersei’s younger brother) is reported to read all night long. Luwin replies that he’d heard that Tyrion drinks all night long. Catelyn is surprised, wondering how much a man of Tyrion’s limited stature could drink. Luwin replies that they’re probably going to find out.

Robb, Theon and Jon have their hair cut ahead of the royal party’s available. Robb reports that he’s heard that the royal prince, Joffrey, is an unpleasant boy. Theon replies that the queen is reportedly a great beauty. Both Robb and Theon laugh as Jon is grumpily groomed by the castle barber, Tommy, saying he has never met a girl he likes more than his own hair.
Jaime goes looking for Tyrion. His first port of call is the brothel located in Winterfell’s outlying town.

Tyrion is visiting with a whore named Ros. Feigning ignorance of who he is, Ros gossips about the king being in Winterfell, along with the queen and her twin brother, who is reported to be the most handsome man in the Seven Kingdoms. Tyrion asks about her other brother, "the clever one". Ros replies that the rumour is that the clever one is a little lecher ("Prone to all manner of perversions,") whom everyone calls ‘the Imp’. Tyrion, annoyed, says he hates that name. Ros, laughing, tells him they have been expecting him.
 Jaime walks in and tells Tyrion they are being feasted by the Starks at sundown and begs him not to leave him alone with these people. Tyrion reluctantly agrees. Because time is short, Jaime sends another three girls in to help matters long.

Tyrion exchanges pleasantries with Sandor Clegane, Prince Joffrey's bodyguard. Tyrion is severely hungover and is trying to work out what he’s doing going out with the hunting party. Sandor is bemused that he would even try hunting, but Tyrion boasts he is the greatest hunter in the land and his spear never misses. Sandor points out it’s not hunting if you have to pay for it.
 Robert asks Eddard if he is still as good a huntsman as he used to be. Eddard replies no, but he’s still better than Robert. Robert thanks him for accepting his offer, as he knows it was not an easy choice to make. Robert tells Eddard he is the last true friend he has left.
 Before riding out, Eddard exchanges a last smile with Bran, who is watching him leave.

The royal party approaches Winterfell. They are spotted by Bran Stark, who is watching from a rooftop. Bran ably runs across the rooftops of the castle and drops down to the courtyard to report the news to his mother. Catelyn reminds him that he has been forbidden from climbing on the castle walls and asks him to promise not to do it again. He does, but she knows he is lying. She sends him to relay the news to Eddard. She also notes that Bran’s direwolf pup has already grown in size tremendously in the month since he was found.

Robert pays his respects at the tomb of Lyanna Stark, his late betrothed. He tearfully asks Eddard why he buried her in such a cold, dark place. She should have been buried on a hillside somewhere, with the sun and clouds above. Eddard tells him that she was his sister, a Stark of Winterfell, and this is her place. Robert replies that she belonged with him. He still dreams of killing Rhaegar Targaryen every single night. Eddard tells him that it is done and the Targaryens are gone. Robert replies, "Not all of them."

In the Free City of Pentos, across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys Targaryen and her brother Viserys are guests at the manse of Magister Illyrio Mopatis. Whilst waiting for her bath, Daenerys is visited by her brother. Illyrio has sent gifts for the wedding feast. Daenerys is puzzled as to why Illyrio has hosted them in his home for more than a year and lavished them with gifts. Viserys replies that it is because Illyrio is not a fool, and he knows that Viserys will richly reward him once he takes back his kingdom. He has Daenerys undressed and advises her to show off her woman’s body. He needs her to be perfect today, lest she "wake the dragon". Departing, Viserys says that when they write the history of his reign, they will say it began on this day.
 Daenerys, unmoved by her brother's arrogance, gets into her bath. Her servant is shocked, as the bath is so hot that it should scald her, but Daenerys is unaffected by the heat.

The party returns to Winterfell over a bridge, only to find a dead stag with its entrails spilled out. Eddard is puzzled by what could have caused this. The puzzle is solved when they find a dead direwolf nearby, with one of the stag’s antlers still caught in its throat. According to Robb, there are no direwolves south of the Wall. Jon points out that there are now five: the direwolf was female, and had just given birth to a litter of pups.
 Bran asks what will become of them and Rodrik points out that direwolves don’t belong south of the Wall. Eddard agrees they should be killed and Theon reaches for the first one. Jon stops him by pointing out that there are five pups, one for each of the Stark children. The direwolf is the symbol of House Stark, so the children were meant to have them. Eddard reflects on this for a moment and then agrees. However, the children must care for them themselves, even burying them if they die. Bran asks Jon why he did not include himself in the count, and he replies that he is not a Stark. However, just as they are leaving he finds a sixth pup, an albino, cowering behind a tree. Theon points out that it’s the runt of the litter, and as such belongs to Jon.

Jaime Lannister bumps into Eddard Stark at the feast. Jaime tells him he is glad to hear that Eddard might be coming south with them. He also remarks that Robert will likely hold a tournament to celebrate if Eddard accepts his offer, noting that competition on the field has gotten a little stale. Irritated, Eddard says he does not fight in tournaments. Jaime tries to bait him, asking if he is too old for it. Eddard replies that when he fights a man for real, he does not want him to know what he can do. Jaime is surprised by the response and compliments Eddard for it.

In King’s Landing, the capital city of the Seven Kingdoms, Queen Cersei Lannister meets with her twin brother, Jaime, a knight of the Kingsguard. They watch the Silent Sisters tending to the body of the late King’s Hand, Lord Jon Arryn. Jaime tells Cersei that she worries too much, whilst she replies that he doesn’t worry enough. She recalls the time he jumped a hundred feet into the sea at Casterly Rock and showed no caution. Jaime replies there was nothing to be afraid of, at least until she told their father.
 Cersei is worried that Arryn told someone, like her husband, King Robert Baratheon, about what he had discovered. Jaime points out they would both be dead if that was the case. Whatever Arryn knew died with him, and Robert will choose a new Hand and go back to hunting boars and chasing whores. Life will return to normal. Cersei is less confidant. She suggests that Jaime should be Hand, but Jaime finds the notion unappealing: their days are too long and their lives are too short.
Arya flings some food at Sansa, to Robb’s hilarity. Catelyn catches Robb’s eye and he ushers Arya out of the room, to her annoyance.

Robert continues to fondle the serving woman at the feast. Hoping to distract Cersei from the sight, Catelyn makes small talk. Sansa is presented to the queen and Cersei compliments her on her dress and beauty. She asks about Sansa’s age and, to Catelyn and Sansa’s discomfort, if she has bled yet; Sansa replies no. After she leaves, Cersei tells Catelyn that Sansa will do well in the Capital, as her youth and beauty should not be hidden up here. Catelyn seems somewhat distressed by her words. Sansa exchanges another smile with Prince Joffrey as she returns to her seat.

links.speech: Are you as good with a spear as you used to be?
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: We both did.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Is ‘no’ the only word that you know?
links.speaker: daenerys

links.speech: Ser Jorah Mormont of Bear Island. I served your father for many years. Gods be good, I hope to always serve the rightful king.
links.speaker: jorah

links.speech: Thank you, ser. Are you from my country?
links.speaker: daenerys

links.speech: A small gift for the new Khaleesi. Songs and histories from the Seven Kingdoms.
links.speaker: jorah

links.speech: A Dothraki wedding without at least three deaths is considered a dull affair.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: Dragons’ eggs, Daenerys. From the Shadow Lands beyond Asshai. The ages have turned them to stone, but they will always be beautiful.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: When do I meet with the Khal? We need to begin planning the invasion.
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: My queen.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: No.
links.speaker: khal_drogo

links.speech: I piss on Dothraki omens. I waited 17 years to get my throne back.
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: Who have we here? You must be Robb. (To Sansa) My, you’re a pretty one. (To Arya) Your name is?
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: When their omens favor war.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: When?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: If Khal Drogo has promised you a crown, you shall have it.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: What d’you expect? They’re savages. One lot steals a goat from another lot and before you know it, they’re ripping each other to pieces.
links.speaker: royce

links.speech: Do you have to?
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Whatever did it to them could do it to us. They even killed the children.
links.speaker: will

links.speech: Where is our brother? Go find the little beast.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: My queen.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: I’m sure it’s very grim, after Kings Landing. I remember how scared I was when Ned brought me up here for the first time.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Hello, little dove. But you are a beauty. How old are you?
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: I’m good.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: Yes. Lovely country.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: Thirteen, Your Grace.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: Clever girl.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: Oh? I hear he’s more than earned it. I hear he’s a drunken little lecher into all manner of perversions.
links.speaker: ros

links.speech: I hear he hates that nickname.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: I hear they call him the Imp.
links.speaker: ros

links.speech: There’s the pretty one. And there’s the clever one.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: The queen has two brothers?
links.speaker: ros

links.speech: And the queen. And her twin brother. They say that he is the most handsome man in the Seven Kingdoms.
links.speaker: ros

links.speech: There are no direwolves south of the Wall.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: Tough old beast.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: You want to hold it?
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: Now there are five.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: We’ve been expecting you, Lord Tyrion.
links.speaker: ros

links.speech: Trust me, Your Grace. If he didn’t like her, we’d know.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: It won’t be long now. Soon you will cross the Narrow Sea and take back your father’s throne. The people drink secret toasts to your health. They cry out for their true king.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: But he didn’t say anything. Did he like her?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: Come forward, my dear.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: Where’s he going?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: When will they be married?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: (Greets them in Dothraki.) May I present my honored guests? Viserys of House Targaryen, the third of his name. The rightful King of the Andals and the First Men. And his sister, Daenerys, of the House Targaryen.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: Soon. The Dothraki never stay still for long.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: Is it true they lie with their horses?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: The ceremony is over.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: I take you for a king. Kings lack the caution of common men. My apologies if I’ve given offense.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: I wouldn’t ask Khal Drogo.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: You did well.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: What is it?
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: The White Walkers have been gone for thousands of years.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Is it true he saw the White Walkers?
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: A madman sees what he sees.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: So take me with you when you go back.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: I’ve never seen wildlings do a thing like this. I’ve never seen a thing like this, not ever in my life.
links.speaker: will

links.speech: It’s a good thing we’re not children. You want to run away south, run away. Of course, they will behead you as a deserter … If I don’t catch you first. Get back on your horse. I won’t say it again.
links.speaker: royce

links.speech: But do you understand why I had to kill him?
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Jon said he was a deserter.
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Our way is the old way?
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and protector of the realm, I, Eddard of the House Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North, sentence you to die.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Father will know if you do.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: You understand why I did it?
links.speaker: ned

links.scene: The king’s party passes through Winterfell’s outlying town, where they are observed by Arya Stark (wearing a Stark guardsman’s helmet for reasons of whimsy). She watches the procession in fascination, but then has to rush back inside the castle to get there ahead of the royal party.

links.speech: All these years and I still feel like an outsider when I come here.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: That’s an honor I can do without. Their days are too long, their lives are too short.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: My husband.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: But who would he tell?
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: You should be the Hand of the king.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: If he told the king, both our heads would be skewered on the city gates by now. Whatever Jon Arryn knew or didn’t know, it died with him. And Robert will choose a new Hand of the king, someone to do his job while he’s off fucking boars and hunting whores. Or is it the other way around? And life will go on.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: Tell me.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: I am so sorry, my love.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: What if Jon Arryn told someone?
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: There was a raven from Kings Landing. Jon Arryn is dead. A fever took him. I know he was like a father to you.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: It’s your gods with all the rules.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: I wonder if the old gods agree.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: I heard you the first time. (To BRAN) Quite the little climber, aren’t you? How old are you, boy?
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: He saw us!
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: I know what I’m putting you through. Thank you for saying yes. I only ask you because I need you. You’re a loyal friend. You hear me? A loyal friend. The last one I’ve got.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: I hope I’ll serve you well.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Come on, you.
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: You will. And I’ll make sure you don’t look so fucking grim all the time. Come on, boys, let’s go kill some boar!
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: Did you hear the king’s in Winterfell?
links.speaker: ros

links.speech: And the other brother?
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: Ten.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: Mmh. It is true what they say about the Northern girls.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: Ten
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: I’m not trying to honor you. I’m trying to get you to run my kingdom while I eat, drink, and whore my way to an early grave. Damn it, Ned, stand up. You helped me win the Iron Throne, now help me keep the damn thing. We were meant to rule together. If your sister had lived, we would have been bound by blood. Well, it’s not too late. I have a son, you have a daughter. We’ll join our Houses.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: I did hear something about that.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: He spent half his life fighting Robert’s wars. He owes him nothing. (To NED) Your father and brother rode south once on a king’s demand.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: The king rode for a month to ask Lord Stark’s help. He’s the only one he trusts. You swore the king an oath, my lord.
links.speaker: luwin

links.speech: A different time. Different king.
links.speaker: luwin

links.speech: You don’t think he’ll ask us how they died? Get back on your horse.
links.speaker: royce

links.speech: Lysa’s head would be on a spike right now if the wrong people had found that letter. Do you think she would risk her life, her son’s life, if she wasn’t certain her husband was murdered?
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: She’s fresh widowed, Cat. She doesn’t know what she’s saying.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: They murdered the last Hand. Now you want Ned to take the job.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: If this news is true, and the Lannisters conspire against the throne, who but you can protect the king?
links.speaker: luwin

links.speech: This was sent from the Eyrie. What’s she doing at the Eyrie? She hasn’t been back there since her wedding.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Stay.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: She’s fled the capital. She says Jon Arryn was murdered. By the Lannisters. She says the king is in danger.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: What news?
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Pardon, my lord, my lady. A rider in the night from your sister.
links.speaker: luwin

links.speech: Send him in.
links.speaker: ned

links.scene: Drogo and Daenerys ride to an outcropping of rock away from the party. Drogo removes their clothes. Daenerys, nervous, asks him if he can speak the common tongue, but he only replies, "No," apparently the only word of her language he knows.

Bran misses the target, causing Robb and Jon (and his younger brother Rickon) to burst into laughter. Eddard berates them, asking which of them was a marksman at ten. Bran goes to take another shot, but before he can another arrow whizzes past his ear and strikes the target perfectly: Bran turns around to see Arya standing there with a bow while his older siblings gawk in amazement at their younger sister. Annoyed, he chases her around the courtyard as his older brothers laugh gleefully and urge him on.
 The frivolity is interrupted by the arrival of Winterfell’s master-at-arms, Ser Rodrik Cassel, and Eddard’s ward (and hostage for his rebellious father’s good behaviour), Theon Greyjoy. Rodrik reports that a deserter from the Night’s Watch has been taken in the hills. The law is clear: he must be executed. Eddard agrees to attend to the matter. He orders that Robb and Jon will join them and then, after a moment’s reflection, Bran. Catelyn objects: Bran is too young to see such things. Eddard responds that Bran won’t be a boy forever and that winter is coming. After he leaves, Catelyn gives Jon Snow a look of loathing.

Eddard takes Robert into the crypts and asks for news of Jon Arryn. Robert tells him that it was a fever that burned right through him before anything could be done. They reminisce about Arryn, whom they both saw as a father figure. He never had to teach Eddard much, but he set Robert to rights. Robert regrets he didn’t always listen to him.
 Robert asks Eddard to serve him as Hand of the King. Eddard says he is not worthy of the honour, but Robert tells him it isn’t an honour. He wants Eddard to run his kingdom for him whilst he eats, drinks and whores his way to an early grave. Robert tells Eddard that he helped him win the Iron Throne and now he can help him keep it. If Eddard’s sister had lived, they’d have been bound by blood. Robert says it’s not too late, and also offers to betroth Joffrey to Sansa and join their houses. Eddard is stunned.

links.speech: Where is he?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: No.
links.speaker: daenerys

links.speech: Daenerys! There’s our bride to be! Look – a gift from Illyrio. Touch it. Come on. Feel the fabric. Mmmm. Isn’t he a gracious host?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: It’s too hot, my lady.
links.speaker: maid

links.speech: When they write the history of my reign, sweet sister, they will say it began today.
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: The Dothraki are not known for their punctuality.
links.speaker: illyrio

links.speech: Our orders were to track the wildlings. We tracked them. They won’t trouble us no more.
links.speaker: gared

links.speech: Not all of them.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: She belonged with me.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: Do the dead frighten you?
links.speaker: royce

links.speech: It’s done, Your Grace. The Targaryens are gone.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Illyrio is no fool. He knows I won’t forget my friends when I come into my throne. You still slouch. Let me see. (He pulls off her gown.) You have a woman’s body now. (She endures it as he strokes her breast.) I need you to be perfect today. Can you do that for me? You don’t want to wake the dragon, do you?
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: Daenerys!
links.speaker: viserys

links.speech: In my dreams, I kill him every night.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: We’ve been his guests for over a year and he’s never asked us for anything.
links.speaker: daenerys

links.scene: A rider bears news of the capture to Winterfell, riding through the outlying countryside and into the castle.

links.speech: Where’s the Imp?
links.speaker: arya

links.speech: I didn’t pick you for a hunter.
links.speaker: the_hound

links.speech: Mountain lion?
links.speaker: theon

links.speech: The greatest in the land. My spear never misses.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: I don’t care about that.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: Please, please. It’s the only thing I ever wanted.
links.speaker: sansa

links.speech: Is he dead yet?
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: I’m ready to swear your oath.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: Father will let me if you ask him, I know he will.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: You don’t understand what you’d be giving up. We have no families. None of us will ever father sons.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: Quick, Bran, faster!
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: Quick, Bran, faster!
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: The Wall isn’t going anywhere.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: Jon…
links.speaker: benjen

links.scene:
Magister Illyrio, Daenerys and Viserys await the arrival of their guest, Khal Drogo of the Dothraki. Viserys complains that Drogo is late and Illyrio replies that the Dothraki are not known for their punctuality.
 Drogo and his bloodriders arrive. Viserys notes the length of Drogo’s braided hair. When Dothraki are defeated in combat, they must cut off their hair so the whole world can see their shame. Drogo has never been defeated. Viserys says that Drogo is a savage, but also one of the finest killers alive. Daenerys is to be his queen.
 Illyrio presents Daenerys to Drogo. Drogo says nothing and rides off. Viserys is startled and asks if he liked her. Illyrio replies that if he didn’t like her, they’d know about it.

links.speech: Well, you’re always welcome on the wall. No bastard was ever refused a seat there.
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: Lady Stark thought it might insult the royal family to seat a bastard in their midst.
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: You got bigger. I rode all day. Didn’t want to leave you alone with the Lannisters. Why aren’t you at the feast?
links.speaker: benjen

links.speech: Uncle Benjen!
links.speaker: jon

links.speech: Aye.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Rough night, Imp?
links.speaker: the_hound

links.speech: If I get through this without squirting from one end or the other, it will be a miracle.
links.speaker: tyrion

links.speech: Winter is coming.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: As your brother, I feel it’s my duty to warn you
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: They were here.
links.speaker: will

links.speech: What is it?
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: And you never worry about anything. When we were seven, you jumped off the cliffs as Casterly Rock. One hundred foot drop into the water. And you were never afraid.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: I’m sorry, Bran.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: There was nothing to be afraid of until you told father. [In a whisper, mimicking] We’re Lannisters. Lannisters don’t act like fools.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: Put away your blade.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: I take orders from your father, not you.
links.speaker: theon

links.speech: He saw us.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: It’s all right. It’s all right.
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: The runt of the litter. That one’s yours, Snow.
links.speaker: theon

links.speech: Stop. STOP.
links.speaker: cersei

links.speech: Are you completely mad?
links.speaker: jaime

links.speech: Move!
links.speaker: arya

links.speech: What?
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: You always look at your feet before you lie. Run and find your father. Tell him the king is close.
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Where’s Arya? Sansa, where’s your sister?
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Hey,, hey, hey, hey. What are you doing with that on? [Pulls off ARYA’s helm]
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: But he’s coming right now! Down our road!
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: I want you to promise me
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: I promise.
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: D’you know what?
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: Go on, Tommy, shave him good. He’s never met a girl he likes better than his own hair.
links.speaker: robb

links.speech: Gods, but they grow fast. [Seeing BRAN on the wall] Brandon!
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: I saw the king! He’s got hundreds of people!
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: How many times have I told you
links.speaker: catelyn

links.speech: It’s a freak.
links.speaker: theon

links.speech: There are no mountain lions in these woods.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: It’s not hunting if you pay for it.
links.speaker: the_hound

links.speech: It’s a direwolf.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Right. Give it here.
links.speaker: theon

links.speech: Better a quick death. They won’t last without their mother.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: NO!
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: They don’t belong down here.
links.speaker: cassel

links.speech: How close did you get?
links.speaker: royce

links.speech: Where will they go? Their mother’s dead.
links.speaker: bran

links.speech: No, but I’m still better than you.
links.speaker: ned

links.speech: Ned.
links.speaker: robert

links.speech: We’ve been riding for a month, my love. Surely the dead can wait.
links.speaker: cersei
